Chemical-specific Prevention Steps

Epichlorohydrin storage tank is located in a containment dike to contain any spills and prevent any vehicles or forklifts collisions. A nitrogen blanket is used for the storage tank to ensure the tank contents remain at less than 8 percent oxygen. The storage tank will be equipped with level measurement, alarms and shutdown of unloading pumps to avoid overfilling.

Five-year Accident History

The facility accident history indicates continuous safe operation of all covered chemical processes over the last five years. There were no covered process releases that resulted in an EPA RMP recordable accident.

Emergency Response Programs

SCT’s emergency response plan includes immediately evacuating facility of personnel and calling the fire department and trained and certifies emergency responders. Only trained and certified emergency responders will respond to emergency situations.

Facility Description and Regulated Substance

Southern Chemical & Textiles, Inc., (SCT) located at 653 Peek Road, Dalton, Georgia is a chemical manufacturing facility that stores, handles and uses Epichlorohydrin (CAS Number 106-89-8) that is regulated by the United States Environmental Protection Agency’s (EPA's) Risk Management Program rule. SCT uses Epichlorohydrin to manufacture products. The maximum inventory of Epichlorohydrin at any given time is 73,800 lbs.

Accidental Release Prevention Policy

SCT has a written process to inspect the equipment regularly to minimize the possibility of accidental chemical releases and written operational safety programs that ensure safe operations at the facility.

Prevention Program

SCT has a comprehensive accident prevention program in place to comply with the accidental release prevention requirements outlined in 40 CFR Part 68. This program consists of process safety controls, including:

•	Technical documentation of process safety information which describes the physical properties of the Epichlorohydrin, the safety systems in place to control Epichlorohydrin, and the standard operating procedures associated with all equipment and systems.

•	Procedures and programs to develop, maintain, and control key program elements such as procedures that address various modes of operation such as initial startup, normal operation, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency operations, normal shutdown and startup after turnaround. The information is regularly reviewed and is readily accessible to operators involved in the processes.

•	Training: SCT has a comprehensive training program in place to ensure that employees who are operating processes are competent in the operating procedures associated with these processes
